reviews.review_msg: Robert is a super nice guy and does his best to teach a pretty boring class. Grading is based almost entirely on two papers and a final all of which were marked fairly. Make sure to study some of the weekly readings for the finals as one of them will be on there.
Interesting and engaging lectures for an hr course. Midterm and final had very high averages (79% and 89%). Don't bother with the textbook, the slides are enough to get a good mark.

Hahaha, he is the great professor, but his final exam average was around 89% (ONLY "B") based on the curve. You could see how his exam was easy but super hard to get competitive grades. And make sure you will finish the 30% paper strongly with your group mate!

Hahaha, he is the great professor, but his final exam average was around 89% (ONLY "B") based on the curve. You could see how his exam was easy but super hard to get competitive grades. And make sure you kill the 30% paper!

Professor Robert is super caring and sets the course up for your success. Recorded lectures help a lot. Exams are easy with high averages. Just read the textbook and review slides regularly. Also, make sure you're in a good group and pick an interesting topic for the paper.
He is the best professor I have ever met at Beedie during this four year!

I was 40% below on the midterm but this mans the goat. He not only PASSED me but gave me an A-! Got my first A range in beddie! This is GOAT behaviour and I definitely recommend taking him. But beware of the high averages (~90%).

Robert is a great guy, clearly very interested in what he is teaching and whats you to be as well. He is quite funny with lots of stories to tell. The lectures can be a bit dry at times but he does his best to make them lively. If you can take a class with Robert do it, very much worth it.

So hard 
Awful marker
Boring

Robert is one of the best profs I have had at Beedie. He is excellent at explaining what would be difficult concepts so that they are easier to understand. His extensive experience and education make him a fantastic HR prof. His exams are fair and you know exactly what to expect. Highly recommend.

pretty boring class overall. didn't learn much, just BS HR jargon. however, prof was a very nice guy and clearly cares about his students. he is passionate about the subject matter, not his fault the subject matter sucks.

Ima be honest I only attended 2 of his lectures after finding out they were recorded but he is a caring and supportive prof. He seems really passionate about what he teaches in his lectures. The assignments and tests were very fair and I enjoyed this class.

Robert is very educated on the topic of HR and his lectures often provide many real life examples to expand your understanding. Exams do have high averages, but if you read the textbook you'll do fine. I recommend him if you chose to take 381, he's the best prof for it. Lectures are also recorded which is nice.
Robert is prof you must take for this class. He is great and his exams are generally easy

Robert is such a great, kind-hearted person. He truly cares about his students and wants them to succeed. There was a midterm, a group paper, a guest reflection, and a final. His lectures are kind of dry and likes to go on little tangents. However, they are not mandatory as they are recorded and you can read through the slides on your own time.

Robert seems like a nice guy, but for someone who specializes in HR is was very surprised to see how little care he had to accommodate students in unique circumstances. Additionally, his lectures were long and boring. Assignments did not have clear grading criteria and exams tested how fast you can write rather than how much you know.

Very nice, understandable and caring prof. Explains concepts in depth with real-life scenarios. I'm not a HR student so I found the content dry and boring at times but I gained a greater appreciation for it. Focus on application of topics as he often gives scenario-based questions during midterms and finals. Keep up with weekly articles.
Best prof I've ever had. I recommend everyone to take his class.

Hands down the best prof ever. He explained the lectures with real-life examples and also with his own experiences which makes the materials easy to understand and engaging. You can tell that he is very passionate in teaching HR and also makes HR seems interesting when the class itself is actually kind of boring.

Robert was fantastic! Super nice and down to earth guy who cared for his students by giving good advice for our papers/tests and extended the term paper when he felt that there was too much stuff going on at once. He also uses his real life experiences to help explain the concepts which makes it more interesting and helpful.

Robert is such a nice guy. He is always accessible and wants the best for his students. He is understanding and extremely polite. So passionate about what he teaches and loves using real life examples. The curve for this course is really high so consistency in grades is very important.

Robert is a good lecturer in SFU. He uses many real-life example of HR to explain concepts in the texts. Robert also cares about his students and try to lower the pressure of them. I believe he will makes you know more on HR and be passionate on it. The only thing bad is the lectures is a bit dry. (Maybe because this is an intro course of HR?)

Caring and easy to get along with. I grew to respect HR a lot more after taking his class. Gives good real life scenarios and stories. However, 3 hours of lectures can be really dry. Only tough aspect of this class was beating the curve with a high 80's average.
Roberts lectures are a bit dry sometimes but are useful, before midterms make sure to go over the main topics of the chapters but read them!

One of the best profs I've taken. Course material may be boring if you're not HR major, but his real life examples make it much more interesting. Works in the industry and is very passionate. Gives bonus marks for super easy 3 min group presentation+2 midterms & final+ group paper. You can choose your group.

Robert is a great prof and a nice guy. The material was dry, but he gave informative examples. The grading scheme was clear and tests were fair. I would recommend reading and taking notes from the textbook in addition to his slides to put yourself above the curve, which is quite high.

Take 381 with Weston! He's such a great guy super caring ! His lectures are kind of dry but he uses great examples from his job! This class is easy to do well in if you have Weston! Only 2 mid-terms, 1 team report and a final! Always accessible in office hours and provides great feedback on areas to improve! Really loved taking this class with him!

Great Prof! Mid-Terms are really easy as long as you read the textbook, make sure not to just rely on the slides because exams include things not mentioned in the lecture. Very straightforward exams. One paper about 2,800 words and you can choice your team of 4. Really caring and approachable. Also provides really good feedback in office hours.

I took his bus 272 two years ago and I really enjoyed his class that's why i decided to take bus 381 with him again. His lectures can be boring sometimes but make sure you take down notes of what he says. Textbook was not required, exams were pretty much based on his lecture slides.

Take DETAILED notes. I started taking super detailed notes after I realized his midterm covered basically everything from lectures (not just the slides but what he talks about that are not on the slides). Got the highest mark in the class on the final by studying only from my notes and lecture slides. Didn't crack the textbook.

He is an amazing professor! The best professor I ever had! A real gem! He truly cares about the students and does whatever he can to make his students succeed. He is very patient and he wants you to get everything he says; even if that means that he has to repeat a few things he has already stated. He is extremely helpful and friendly. MCQ exams!

Do not skip class because he brings up a lot of extra information that will be tested on during the exams. Exams are easy (midterm was mainly MC with 2 short answer questions, final was all MC). Great professor who is really passionate about HR and cares about his students. Start early on the group report and check the criteria often for revisions.

His lectures are mandatory. Chris likes to put random facts that he says in class and put it on the exam. For example, mentioned something very quickly about Uber and it appeared on his midterm exam. If possible, tape record his lectures that would be the fastest way to get an A.
Best professor I ever had! He cares about every single student and he wants everyone to do well. He was very good at keeping the students engaged during the class. He is just purely awesome!

Chris is an amazing professor!! The material can be dry at times, but he's a good lecturer and makes it more interesting by linking it to real life examples and engages students in class discussions, and in-class group activities. The only bummer in this class was the group project - make sure you do adequate research for the paper - TA marks hard.

Chris is awesome!  Brings in a lot of examples and relate to the topics.  Exams are easy but he literally tests everything so be prepared to pay attention in class.  Lecture can get boring so times, but he throws in a few jokes here and there.

Incredible prof,  and an expert in his field. Relates all of his lectures and in class discussions to current events and industry trends. Great, passionate lecturer, makes a dry subject (HR) fascinating and engaging. Warning-exams are super easy, but are also curved. Class average on the first midterm was 83%.

Truly believes in outdated and irrelevant theories that no longer hold any value today.  Has an attitude of a capitalist pig - let's destroy the environment, abuse the people, and make some profit.  This is understandable though - it is hard to admit that your life's work is a joke.

Nice bloke. Explained concepts well. You have to be in a good team to get decent marks in your presentation and team paper. It seems that he thinks we have a light courseload and tends to tell the class at the last minute what he expects from presentations and team papers which annoyed me.

One of the best business profs i've taken at SFU.  Applies textbook concepts to real life situations.  Uses cases that are current and reletive.  Has industry experience and knowledge.  Created enthusiasm for a course that could have been dry and dull without.
Great prof

One of the best lecturers I've had. 1 big group project. Textbook not needed but helps for the exams. Participation is bonus points so not required to attend. She doesn't really veer off topic so much as gives complimentary real world advice. Speaking as an older student who's been in the workforce for 15 years...listen to her: It's good advice.

Prof is horrible. To do well, memorize every detail on her slides & show up to 5 classes (up to 5 bonus marks so people don't skip). Her instructions & grading criteria are unclear and unless asked she will forget. There is a midterm and final (all MC's) and one group term paper. Lectures are boring and she spends the majority of class off topic.
Super kind and helpful Prof! Just choose her without any doubts!

i was really nervous to take bus381 with her after reading all her low reviews, but after taking her class, i can vouch that she is a great lecturer who genuinely cares about HR and your learning. super approachable, kind, and helpful. my one criticism is her participation bonus marks make lectures longer than needed and can side track lecture.
She simply reads off her slides, not much value offered from her lectures. Get ready to memorize all the tiniest details from the textbook for exams.
I lvoe this lady

Do not take this prof. Her midterm and final are MC straight from the textbook. Her lectures are all definitions from the textbook. How she taught the course gave no value to business decision making. The course is so dry and all theory.

The most poorly designed course I have ever taken (BUS 381). Assadi was very lazy, just read off lecture slides every class. Didn't want to do any marking so exams were all multiple choice (40 question midterm, 80 question final), didn't encourage actual understanding of the concepts, and made it very difficult to do well. She really doesn't care..

Dr.Assadi is a good lecturer as she has lots of HR related experiences to tie into the lectures. Your grade is made up mainly with midterm, final, group paper. The group papers are marked really hard and wasn't fun to do. Final was really difficult because the questions seem to expect you to memorize the entire textbook and each little detail.

Long lectures, but she was one of the best lecturers I've had at SFU. Clearly has a lot of real life experience in Human Resources. Well spoken with clear examples. Graded only on 2 projects (1 group 1 solo), a midterm and a final. Graded fairly hard, but got a B overall with a pretty average effort.

Some students argue that Assadi was bland and boring, but I argue that the course, in general, is blonde. I managed to get a A, from just last-minute cramming and didn't mind Assadi at all. Every chapter you finish every week, just summarize it in your own words and you will def get a good mark.

As an intro course, expect to memorize a ton of information with little direction for midterms and finals. I really did not enjoy this class, I found the concepts boring and the teaching style of Dr Assadi ineffective as there wasn't much room for active learning in an engaging way. Shes a bit harsh and cold so beware
This class completely disinterested me from the topic of HR. The 3 hour lectures were dry and boring, with little room for engagement. Questions on the exam were ridiculous. Would not take again.

She is a very calm and caring prof. Her lectures were interesting and the assignments were not too difficult. The assignments made up the majority of the grade, with one final exam at the end of the semester. Overall, would highly recommend for any HR courses.

Bahareh Assadi was a great lecturer. She never had long lectures and made sure to stay engaging throughout them. There was a multiple choice only midterm and final, as well as a group paper. Everything seemed very fair and her feedback on the paper was very valuable. I wish more profs were like her.

Assadi is do doubt the best prof out there. She is really motivated, and inspirational. She made the class so much fun, by sharing stories from her own life. The class is overall a gpa booster. Really helpful and gives a lot of feedback. Exams are based on slides and super easy.
Bahareh is very knowledgeable and has high interest in her field, always making the lectures interesting and engaging. Very good Instructor and very caring.
She is lovely and knowledgeable. Her lecture slides are very informational. The class curve is high. Recommended.

Overall, shes a pretty sweet and caring prof. Very easy to talk to and very approachable. But be warned, the average is high and this course is group intensive so start praying for a randomized group selection throughout your semester. Mid term and Final is all just off her lecture slides.

Great prof. Before taking her course, I had 0 interest in human resources. Lectures are engaging, and workload is pretty minimal. Marking is fair, but not lenient. Attendance isnt mandatory, but her exams are based on them pretty heavily. She did seem to be a little hurt that a lot of people stopped attending regularly last few weeks of term, haha.

Vanessa is an all-around good lecturer. She knows HR material inside out, and makes it as relevant and applicable as possible. With the shift to online due to COVID-19, the workload was heavier compared to other professors (there's an assignment/quiz due each week, most group-related). Nevertheless, the class was enjoyable with Vanessa.

Vanessa was a great instructor. If you have any questions, she always find time to answer them in a timely manner. She puts lots of effort into her lecturing to make it fun and engaging. She has plenty of academia and job experience that she connects to. Loved her class! Take BUS381 with her :) even though I hate HR depts, she gives me hope

Despite covid protocols and the course moving online, Vanessa made live lectures engaging and not dry. She is clearly passionate about HR and cares for her students. In an online class of 100 students, she made time to answer questions that students had during lecture. Fair marker and accessible. Go to class and you will pass easily.

Vanessa is really passionate and caring and available for questions. She really knows HR. Guest speakers were interesting. There was a hiccup during the midterm but she was generous and gave people a chance to do well on the FInal. I just finished the final and I think it's not hard if you prepared well. We'll see after I get my grade!

Vanessa is a good/passionate lecturer who can explain course materials clearly. She brings in real life examples during lecture and if you pay attention, she gives examples that relate to assignments. Exams are fair, material is fairly straight forward. Keep up with lecture material and you'll do fine in this course.

Vanessa is a really nice teacher and she makes the lectures easy to go through. Overall the course is an easy course, so expect the curve to be high. Most of the midterm questions are based on readings and textbook notes. If you are going into HR then lectures are really useful, but do the readings and take notes and you'll pass.

This was an interesting class. To put things into perspective, the grading is very unclear. Almost every other week, there's an in-class assignment. Tests are from the information in the textbook, and the lectures are pretty pointless. I think it's her first time teaching a class, because the her expectations are very unclear.

I don't agree with the other review for Vanessa. Vanessa's midterm was still quite straight forward and she provided a break between the MC and short answer section which I hadn't experienced before, it helped a bunch. LOTS of group work, you can only hope to have a good group. I think she marks fairly and is often available for any help.

Midterm instruction listed an end time that's 10 min later and many students were kicked out of the canvas quiz midway. Her questions that said (select all the apply) had were not able to multi-select. Briefly after, she emailed everyone that they can re-do some questions, then decided not to and base our midterm MC result on how we do in the final
Great prof! Engaging lectures and made me love coming to class.

Brent is very clear when explaining the course material, he tells you exactly what to study for, and makes the class very enjoyable. He's got a good sense of humour and his attitude towards students is friendly and super supportive. Honestly the nicest professor I have ever encountered. Take HR with no one else.

Brent was a phenomenal professor. He made content easy to understand and was extremely passionate about the course. He likes to see his students succeed and is willing to provide feedback on your midterm, paper, and final. Be sure to read the textbook to help you get those extra marks on the midterm/final. Attend lectures for  the quizzes!

Such a sweet, organized, and clear professor. Fair marker and final paper is not very difficult as long as you start early. In-class quizzes are easy, so long as you don't fall asleep in class. Only downfall is that the grade range is the smallest I've seen (A- is 84% and B+ is 82 to 83%), and the range from A to C is only 13%

One of the best professors at Beedie. He makes lecture enjoyable, only tests on what he teaches, mid and final are all multiple choice (non-cumulative), and then a relatively short research paper that is easy as long as you pick a topic you enjoy and that's interesting. Good class.

Very enthusiastic and approachable, and actually responds to emails. Tests mostly based on slides, and does thorough exam reviews where he tells you exactly what's going to be tested. Non-cumulative final. Short quiz every class to help you learn the material (and make you show up I guess). Group paper.

One of my fav prof at SFU :) He explained the concepts very well. If you don't want to read the book like me, make sure to take good notes in class and you good to go. However, there are few MCQs in the exams are from the book which is like a bonus for hardworking students. He is strict about the term paper. The tests are not difficult.
My favorite prof in SFU
He is clearly interested in the topic and he cares that you will do well in the class.

Very nice, friendly easy going prof. Weekly quiz at the end of the class. Class was boring and dry but it's mandatory to try to listen cuz of the quiz at the end. Also, midterm and final were heavily focus on the slides material. The average was hard, so be pared to really study otherwise the curve will get you.

Brent is a really nice guy, and knows his stuff, he explains everything you need to know for exams, all test material is on lecture slides, very clear and no surprises  The only downside is that because this is a curved class, the average is really high, my class avg was 82% so need to work hard and study extra to get an A
Go to all the lectures, you will be fine! Textbook is not really needed because his lectures are VERY clear.

Nice guy, but is somewhat hard to follow because he repeats himself a lot and he gets confused too. Ended up fixing midterm grades because wordings on the exam were unclear just like himself. But it's a easy course, hard to fail, but if you don't put extra effort the grade will not be great cuz average was really high.

I've never had a professor like Brent before. He was passionate, somewhat dorky, but did his job for the most part. Lectures were fairly dry and boring, quizzes were straight from the chapter summaries, exams (both midterm and final) were fair. The real kick in the bollocks was from the group work (presentation & paper), because I did all the work.

really straightforward prof. easy going, laid back. all exam material mainly from lecture slides. team project and paper was a pain in the ass but overall the course material is not hard. lectures are engaging. very reasonable and approachable prof. usually 3 hour lectures are boring but brent makes the lectures fun and pass quick.
Lot of exam material from lecture slides, some from textbook

Lisa is such a charming and funny lady. She's able to bring her work experience when teaching HR. Grading is based on two midterms, paper and a final. Exams are all multiple choice and the choices are often tricky (just read carefully). I think shes retiring this semester so no point in this review

She is a good prof. and the course is easy. Her class absolutely doesn't require a textbook but need to prepare thoroughly with the slides. The exams are little tricky and the term paper is easy. These makes the averages super high. Overall I highly recommend the course and the prof.

I enjoyed Lisas lectures so much, shes so funny and informative! Besides HR texbook stuff, she gives a lot of insights about employers that will help students build their employability. Exams shouldnt be too hard if you take notes from her lectures. Shes kinda strict on marking papers so make sure to consult her or the TA.

Lisa is a well-prepared and coherent lecturer. Her class consists of 3 tests weighted for 80% of the course and a group paper, which you should start early. Tests are majority multiple choice; beware, questions are tricky and detail-oriented. Group paper can be the make or break between A's and B's.

Lisa is an amazing professor! Get ready to take notes and remember the examples she talked about in class because they will be on the midterms and final. Exams were pretty easy since it was all mc. Highly recommend her class

Lisa is a great proff. She only tests what she covers in lectures and in her powerpoints, so you do not need the textbook. She uses jokes and real-world examples to make the material more understandable.

This course is very easy. Both mid-term and final are straight-forward. You just need to study and memorize the notes, and then you will do well in exams. I would say the exams are overly easy so that you need to get really high marks to get an A- and better because the averages are so high.

Lisa makes her lectures interactive. Btw you don't need the book, midtermfinal covers only her slides but you need to attend the class since the slides have blank spaces. Final is not cumulative but fair. Term paper is easy and straight forward.

Lisa is a friendly and nice prof. Her lectures don't really follow textbooks materials and orders, but very useful for exam purposes. Attendant is a must if you want to get a good mark on exams because she may ask you things that are not in her ppt but in her lectures only. Lots of examples and stories to make lectures interesting.

Lisa is an awesome prof. She has a lot of experience in the HR industry and shares many of her interesting stories during class. There is only a group presentation and paper for tuts. Her midterm was fair and based only on her notes so make sure to come to class!
Interesting class. Textbook not needed, make sure to attend her classes because everything is based on notes and things she said. Her MC could be quite tricky though

Amazing professor who cares about her students and answers all questions. Exams are fair, based mostly on lecture slides. No textbook needed. Course has a midterm, non-cumulative final, case assignment, and group paper. Can do really well by studying slides alone but lectures help.

Too much memorizing. If you enjoy memorizing all the slides she provided and write a lot in exams, take her. If you prefer MCQ, choose Assadi instead. BUS 381 is not a chill course, maybe choosing 374 will give you a better grade.
Tough course! Take other prof so you don't need to memorize everything from the slides and read everything from the textbook. Those good rates here is not accurate at all

She is kind but the course is too dry. She forced us to memorize everything from the slides for those short, med and long answers in those exams. It was a nightmare studying for midterm and final, even your group project is so good, you cannot survive at all for those written questions in her exams. Totally not taking her again, and not recommended

Melissa is an excellent prof for HR - she is kind, very knowledgeable, and helps break down many difficult concepts into digestible lectures. Melissa supports and really cares for her students. However, the course is difficult-- be prepared to work hard for the group paper, and study a lot of material for the midterm and final.

The lectures are boring, unengaging, and too long. I could get the same information from the textbook. Also been waiting a long time for marks, which were promised before the final exam, but there have been no updates in four days. Overall, this situation is unsatisfactory. Tests are memorization of random topics from the textbook no application.

Lectures boring, goes off on unrelated topics about her work, answers people's personal hr questions unrelated to lecture during lecture time making lecture way longer than needed too. Everyone stopped going to lectures after they realized how useless and boring they are. Just read the textbook as lectures are way longer than necessary. Just bad

Melissa is a great prof for intro to HR. Lectures are packed with info but she gives lots of real world examples, and you can tell she knows what she is talking about. Higher course load than expected, 1-2 readings a week, group paper, 2 individual case assignments, and 2 midterms (each 25%), but no final! She cares a lot about HR and her students.

Relatively heavy workload -   2 mini cases, a group presentation, 14-page group paper, and two midterms (no final). The last midterm took place the week after the group paper was due so it was a bit stressful. Lectures were interesting though and she taught 381 quite well. Overall, would def recommend taking 381 with Melissa.

Melissa was awesome, good lecturer who put a lot of effort into making it an interesting class. Worth attending lecture, the written part of the exams had questions about stuff from videos and guest speakers. Content is pretty easy, but there is quite a bit to do with 2 group assignments. Keep on top of things and you're good to go!
The best prof I've ever had! She knows her materials well and explains them clearly using her work experiences!

Attendance is MANDATORY. Videos shown in class and information guest speakers provide WILL be tested on exams. But aside from that, Melissa is very nice. Material is straight-forward. The book is not interesting at all, but a lot of it is tested. Show up, listen, and you'll get a good mark!

The class is not easy so if you're lazy, don't even bother but if you take it, make sure to take with Melissa. She is a great prof, really knows her material and provides real world experience. Would definitely recommend her.

teaches well.lots of workload.a 14-pg team paper n a group presentation, midterm n final n two lil assn.different topics n groups.demands too much from students.have to go to class.doesnt realize we hav other class and a life.she just wants too much out of this class.a fun class if its only class you take, othereids its hell.
Great prof
Melissa is the best, shes soo nice that you dont even want to skip her class. Make sure u have her as ur tutorial leader.Overall i would love to take another class with her.
No Comments
No Comments

I thought she was only okay. I thought she meant well but she came across very smug. I have never yawned so much in a class. This is the first class I actually fell asleep in! PLUS YOU HAVE TO PAY ATTENTION IN THIS CLASS, HALF HER QUESTIONS CAME FROM SPOKEN CONTENT NOTHING ON THE SLIDES! Would have been easy if I stayed awake.

She is okay. Exams are much based on textbook, but likes to add exam questions that are only shown during lectures (not available in downloaded ppt). She likes to share her experiences and stories, which are okay. She is fairly picky in marking, and expects exact answers (what she thinks is the right answer.)
Boring subject, read the textbook. Shes a nice prof but the content is so dry... Group work is manageable, just try to get a hard working group and you will do fine in this course.

the exams are easy if you just look at concepts in the book and attend some classes. if you go to class you already know half the stuff. also for the projects as long as you get a good group youre fine. for the projects you could completely slack off and still be fine. group participation only counts for 5% of your paper mark, not your total mark ;

The course is easy if you get a good group. She saves some examinable bonus slides for lecture only so ppl who go get extra material. Exams are fair, you can just use common sense if the bonus stuff blindsides you. Horrible accent though and her pronunciation of some words is infuriating. Caring prof with good intentions but attendance optional imo
